intro: Fenzlia beccarii, commonly known as the Beccari's fenzlia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
